reviewText: Let's hope WATER WORLD can be avoided.
This film was well made and put together, and was enjoyable to watch. Was very educational and filled with good information!
liberal one sided B S. environmentalist crap. If you are stupid enough to believe this you better start building the ark.
Spectacular, a beautiful piece of film which shows an unbiased truth that impacts all of us. Excellent narration/ presenter - look forward to seeing him in more.
Too repetitive and needed more relation to climate change. This issue doesn't exist without climate change. Overall, this documentary didn't do this issue justice.

I really enjoyed this film! It was very informative and visually beautiful. I learned quite a few new things about coastal erosion and what is causing it. There was also a good information about methods used to fight coastal erosion and impact of rising tides. I would say that it is a must to be seen by anyone who is interested in this topic, cares about nature and future generations and specifically who live near ocean or sea coast.
a good look at the problem with the climate change denials. Time to act.
Excellent research on this documentary. Would be great viewing for an Intro to Geography class!
Very good information. I like that it's not about pointing fingers, but about possible solutions and working for the future. Gets you thinking "How can I help?"
Very informative with statistical information that backs up projections.
Started strong and gave a lot of good information, but I felt the last 20 minutes kind of trailed off without reinforcing the early points in the documentary.
